p:
In this model, the population is divided into 9 categories ( Fig. 1): Susceptible individuals ( S); Individuals exposed to the zoonotic reservoir ( E
i ) or to infectious humans ( E
s ), Infectious and symptomatic individuals arising from reservoir ( I
i ), or from human-to-human transmission ( I
s ); Asymptomatic and non-infectious individuals arising from environmental/animal exposure ( A
i ) or arising from human-to-human transmission ( A
s ); hospitalized individuals ( H); and removed individuals after recovery or disease-induced death ( R). The total population size ( N) of Saudi Arabia is âˆ¼29 million and assumed to be initially completely susceptible, in line with serosurveys ( Tefanie Gierer et al., 2013, Aburizaiza et al., 2013).
